summary: Email correspondence between attorneys regarding the case US v. Tartaglione, discussing requests for MCC legal visit logs and inmate count logs related to Nicholas Tartaglione, and coordination with the U.S. Attorney's Office. The emails involve defense counsel and prosecutors, referencing a Protective Order and a FOIA request from the NY Times.

events.title: Conference Call on Tartaglione Case
events.description: A conference call was held involving attorneys to discuss issues related to the Protective Order and BOP documents in US v. Tartaglione.

events.title: Request for MCC Logs
events.description: Defense counsel formally requested MCC legal visit logs and inmate count logs for Nicholas Tartaglione from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: White Plains Division, United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Defense attorneys are requesting MCC legal visit logs and inmate count logs for Nicholas Tartaglione (#78514-054) from the U.S. Attorney's Office.
The requests are related to a 'death-authorized case' and are part of preparing for the penalty phase.
The U.S. Attorney's Office is responding to a NY Times FOIA request and may have additional BOP records not previously reviewed by defense counsel.
A Protective Order (Dkt No. 119) regarding BOP documents was previously entered in the case US v. Tartaglione.
Firewall counsel (Margery Feinzig and Ilan Graff) are assigned to handle sensitive documents to avoid conflicts of interest.
